captions.text:
>>THREE, TWO, ONE.
>>HAPPY 18TH BIRTHDAY SON!

>>NOW RISE AND SHINE AND GET OUT OF OUR HOUSE.
>>WHAT?

BUT IT'S MIDNIGHT.
>>IT'S TIME FOR YOU TO LEAVE HOME AND GO
MAKE SOMETHING OF YOURSELF.

YOU'RE NOT A KID ANYMORE.
>>YEAH, LIKE AS OF TEN SECONDS AGO.

>>OKAY.
>>AND DON'T COME BACK TO VISIT UNTIL YOU

HAVE A FULL TIME JOB OR MARRIED
AND HAVE TWO GRAND-BABIES.

>>THREE, TWO, ONE.
>>HAPPY 30TH BIRTHDAY SON!

>>OH, WHAT THE HECK?
WHAT TIME IS IT?

NOON?
I THOUGHT YOU GUYS WERE GOING TO LET ME

SLEEP IN ON MY BIRTHDAY.
>>WE MADE YOU SOME PANCAKES AND BOUGHT

YOU A NEW FLAT SCREEN.
>>OH, MY CELL PHONES BIGGER THAN THAT!

TAKE IT BACK!
>>OH!

OH OKAY!
>>SORRY!

>>LITTLE FEISTY.
>>WELL I FILLED OUT SOME JOB APPLICATIONS

FOR YOU.
ALL YOU NEED TO DO IS SIGN THEM AND I'LL

GO DROP THEM OFF.
>>MOM, I ALREADY HAVE A JOB.

I SELL YOUR GUYS' STUFF ON EBAY.
>>IS THAT WHAT HAPPENED TO OUR REFRIGERATOR?

>>YEAH.
50 BUCKS.

>>WELL WE JUST THINK THAT MAYBE IF YOU HAD
A GIRLFRIEND YOU'D

BE A LITTLE MORE MOTIVATED.
>>YEAH, I KNOW YOUR MOM REALLY HELPED ME WHEN

WE WERE BOTH FULL TIME STUDENTS
WITH FOUR PART-TIME

JOBS AND THREE KIDS AND-- >>BLAH, BLAH, BLAH,
DAD I HAVE LIKE 500 LADY FRIENDS ON FACEBOOK.

ONE OF WHICH I ALMOST MET AT THE MALL,
BUT I GOT NERVOUS SO I BOUGHT A PAIR OF 200-DOLLAR

JEANS AT
THE BANANA REPUBLIC INSTEAD.

SO, YEAH.
I THINK I'M DOING JUST FINE.

>>WE JUST THINK IT'S TIME FOR YOU TO
HAVE A LITTLE

MORE RESPONSIBILITY.
[LAUGHTER] >>YOU TALK OF RESPONSIBILITY?

AND YET YOU TRY TO FEED ME NON-ORGANIC PANCAKES.
>>I'M REALLY WORRIED ABOUT THE NEXT GENERATION.

>>DON'T WORRY DAD.
WE'LL BE JUST FINE.

>>THREE, TWO, ONE.
SURPRISE!

HUMAN SLAVE, HAPPY TENTH BIRTHDAY.
YOU MUST NOW RISE AND SERVE THE MACHINE OVERLORDS.

>>I'LL SERVE THEM WITH HONOR ROBOT FATHER.
>>SURPRISE!

comments.author: Morgan McRee

comments.text:
Just think though, It came to be that way because of how people were raised 
in the past. Short term sending your children out into the world completely 
unprepared with no support is great but in the long term it created whiny 
self centered douche bags. You could blame it on the parents of the 
generation but those parents had parents and their parents had parents they 
all learned something wrong about raising children somewhere down the line 
this problem didn't just pop up suddenly.﻿

comments.author: Jessa Moore

comments.text:
Sadly, no one ever seems to look at why this might be. What was different 
in the 1950s over 2013? When one looks at average income as a percentage of 
GDP, they'll see that, here in 2013, we've turned "oppressing the hireling 
in his wages" into an art form! College costs no longer only ask your 
firstborn child (figuratively speaking), they now want your entire progeny 
and most of your organs in payment. Then, once you get out of college, 
there's a good chance you won't be able to find a job in your chosen 
carrier path, or any job that pays more than minimum wage. The loans then 
haunt you for the rest of your life, always threatening to take what little 
subsistance you can eek out. This is the future may young people see ahead 
of them, so is it any wonder they don't venture out into a world where your 
rent will likely take over half your income? Then there's healthcare, which 
you almost certainly won't be able to afford... Unless you want to work for 
the big businesses and banks and become part of the system creating so many 
problems. There are serious issues underneath this problem, issues that are 
causing problems all over the globe. The issue is not just "Oh, look at 
those spoiled kids still living at home". It is a MUCH more systemic 
problem than that. Income inequality breeds greed, malice, crime, laziness, 
and whole brood of other problems. That's why we have D&C 49:20 (and I'm 
sure my familiarity with this verse has *nothing* to do with what is 
written 2 verses up... Me being vegetarian and all, I love the idea that 
whoever forbids someone to abstain from meat - i.e. forbids someone to be a 
vegetarian since vegetarians, by definition, abstain from meat - is not 
ordained of God). :) Anyway, even though I've studied some of the 
underlying real world problems behind such trends, I still found the skit 
funny. :)﻿
